com.vmware.vcenter.trusted_infrastructure.trust_authority_clusters.attestation.tpm2

Interface CaCertificates

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CaCertificatesTypes, com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService, Service
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CaCertificatesStub

    public interface CaCertificates
extends Service, CaCertificatesTypes, com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService
    The CaCertificates interface provides methods to manage Trusted Platform Module (TPM) CA certificates.

    Endorsement Keys are typically packaged in a certificate that is signed by a certificate authority (CA). This interface allows the CA certificate to be registered with the Attestation Service in order to validate TPM EK certificates when presented at attestation time.

    . This interface was added in vSphere API 7.0.0.0.

    • Method Detail

      • list

        CaCertificates.ListInvocation list(java.lang.String cluster)
        Return a list of configured TPM CA certificates on a cluster. This method was added in vSphere API 7.0.0.0.

        Invocation Result:
        A list of configured TPM CA certificates.

        Parameters:
        cluster - The id of the cluster on which the operation will be executed. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.
        Returns:
        instance of CaCertificates.ListInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described list operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        Error - if there is a generic error.
        InvalidArgument - if cluster id is empty.
        NotFound - if the cluster doesn't match to any cluster in the vCenter or given name is not found.
        Unauthenticated - if the caller is not authenticated.

      • create

        CaCertificates.CreateInvocation create(java.lang.String cluster,
                                       CaCertificatesTypes.CreateSpec spec)
        Add a new TPM CA certificate on a cluster. This method was added in vSphere API 7.0.0.0.
        Parameters:
        cluster - The id of the cluster on which the operation will be executed. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.
        spec - The new CA certificate details.
        Returns:
        instance of CaCertificates.CreateInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described create operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        AlreadyExists - if the certificate name exists.
        Error - if there is a generic error.
        InvalidArgument - if the configuration is invalid or the cluster id is empty.
        NotFound - if cluster doesn't match to any cluster in the vCenter.
        Unauthenticated - if the caller is not authenticated.

      • get

        CaCertificates.GetInvocation get(java.lang.String cluster,
                                 java.lang.String name)
        Get the TPM CA certificate details on a cluster. This method was added in vSphere API 7.0.0.0.

        Invocation Result:
        CA certificate info.

        Parameters:
        cluster - The id of the cluster on which the operation will be executed. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: ClusterComputeResource.
        name - The CA certificate name. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.trusted_infrastructure.trust_authority_clusters.attestation.tpm2.CaCertificate.
        Returns:
        instance of CaCertificates.GetInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described get operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        Error - if there is a generic error.
        InvalidArgument - if the name is invalid or cluster id is empty.
        NotFound - if the CA certificate is not found or cluster doesn't match to any cluster in the vCenter.
        Unauthenticated - if the caller is not authenticated.
